task_summary: The robot is tasked to pick a tube from a shelf, requiring perception, approach, grasp planning, and successful grasp confirmation.

task_long_description.overview: This sequence controls a robot arm to locate and pick a cylindrical tube placed in a shelf cubicle. The system initiates with perception to detect the tube, followed by a top approach maneuver. Grasp planning ensures a successful and stable pickup before confirmation. The sequence relies on visual feedback for alignment and success is verified by object detection in the gripper.
preconditions: Tube is present and visible in the scene
Robot is within reach of the shelf
stepwise_plan: Check if the tube is visible; trigger raster scan if not
Move above the tube with a small offset
Compute grasp pose with a top strategy
Approach and align to minimize tolerances
Execute the grasp at computed pose
Confirm tube is held in the gripper
success_criteria: Tube is securely held by the gripper
No collisions with shelf or environment
No object slip during approach or grasp
failure_and_recovery: Failure to see tube: retry raster scan up to 3 times
Grasp fail: sequence ends (not covered by further retries here)
task_long_description.termination: On positive tube-in-gripper detection or unresolvable perception/grasp failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the tube is visible for perception.
Actively scans the workspace to locate the tube using a raster pattern.
Detects/refines position of the tube in the workspace.
Opens the gripper in preparation to grasp the tube.
Moves the gripper just above the tube before approach.
Computes a top grasp pose over the tube; result key is std_top.
Aligns and approaches the tube with tight tolerance.
Performs grasp at the computed pose using a top strategy.
Verifies the tube is held within the gripper.

failure_modes: Tube out of reach or occluded
recovery_strategy: Retry visual scan up to 3 times
Abort if tube not detected or not grasped
assumptions: The tube is the object being picked (white cylindrical, bottom shelf center); no explicit force or tolerance in instruction.
Approach, grasp, and verification are visually inferred from arm/tube/shelf geometry.

expected_success_criteria: Tube detected in gripper after grasp, no collision
